# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/distro/__init__.py
@source-hash: d9f1e317e49f80fb
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:38Z

## Primary Purpose
Package initialization module for the `distro` library, providing a public API interface for Linux distribution detection and information retrieval. Acts as a facade that re-exports all functionality from the internal `distro.distro` module.

## Key Components

### Imports (L1-26)
- Imports comprehensive set of functions, classes, and constants from `.distro` module
- Includes `LinuxDistribution` class - the main interface for distribution detection
- Imports utility functions for version parsing (`major_version`, `minor_version`, `version_parts`)
- Imports information retrieval functions (`info`, `name`, `codename`, `id`)
- Imports release-specific functions (`os_release_info`, `lsb_release_info`, `distro_release_info`)
- Imports normalization constants (`NORMALIZED_DISTRO_ID`, `NORMALIZED_LSB_ID`, `NORMALIZED_OS_ID`)

### Public API Definition (L28-52)
- `__all__` list explicitly defines the public interface
- Excludes `__version__` from `__all__` but still available as module attribute
- Contains 22 public functions/classes/constants for comprehensive Linux distribution introspection

### Version Handling (L54)
- Re-exports `__version__` from the internal module
- Provides version information for the package

## Dependencies
- Internal dependency on `.distro` module containing actual implementation
- No external dependencies in this initialization file

## Architectural Pattern
Classic Python package initialization pattern using facade design:
- Centralizes all public API exports in one location
- Hides internal module structure from consumers
- Provides clean import interface (`from distro import id, name, version`)
- Maintains backwards compatibility through stable public interface

## Usage Context
Part of pip's vendored dependencies, specifically for detecting Linux distribution information in cross-platform package management scenarios. Essential for platform-specific package resolution and compatibility checking.
